Source: MCC (mcc.ca/examinations fees 2025-26): MCCQE1=CAD$1395 NAC OSCE=CAD$2830 MCCQE2=CAD$2665; CPSO (cpso.on.ca registration 2025-26): initial certificate of registration=CAD$525; CaRMS (carms.ca/the-match/fees 2025-26): application fee CAD$325 base + ~15 programs × CAD$35/program = ~CAD$850 typical; physiciansapply.ca: source verification CAD$395 + WES evaluation ~CAD$300 = ~CAD$695 total; IRCC (canada.ca): work permit CAD$255 open work permit CAD$100 biometrics CAD$85; Express Entry PR: processing CAD$850 + RPRF CAD$515 + biometrics CAD$85 = CAD$1450; OET (occupationalenglishtest.org): AUD$587 ≈ INR37500 at AUD/INR 63.42; IELTS India (britishcouncil.in): ~INR17000; Coaching (BEMDCanada/CanadaQBank/NAC OSCE prep providers market research): INR50k-150k; Indian PCC (passportindia.gov.in): INR500 official + processing; Panel physician medical exam India: INR10k-15k; Flights (Delhi/Mumbai to Toronto/Vancouver economy return): INR55k-90k
Notes: COMPONENT COLUMN VALUES = typical/single-attempt scenario at CAD/INR 61.00 (Feb 2026 mid-market rate from Wise/XE). --- PATHWAY: MCCQE Part 1 → NAC OSCE → CaRMS residency match → MCCQE Part 2 → LMCC license. MCCQE Part 2 is taken during or after residency. --- MIN SCENARIO (INR 6,54,440): 1× MCCQE1 (85095) + 1× NAC OSCE (172630) + 1× MCCQE2 (162565) + IELTS not OET (17000) + Provincial license CPSO (32025) + CaRMS base fee 10 programs (CAD$325+10×$35=CAD$675=41175) + Credential verification (42395) + Work permit only CAD$255 (15555) + NO PR (0) + No coaching (0) + Budget travel 1 trip (50000) + Budget accommodation (24000) + PCC (2000) + Medical (10000) = INR 6,54,440. --- TYPICAL SCENARIO (INR 8,81,430): 1× MCCQE1 (85095) + 1.5× avg NAC OSCE attempts (258945) + 1× MCCQE2 (162565) + OET (37500) + CPSO (32025) + CaRMS ~15 programs (51850) + Credential verification (42395) + Work permit (15555) + NO PR (0) + Mid coaching (75000) + Travel 1 trip (65000) + Standard accommodation (40000) + PCC (3500) + Medical (12000) = INR 8,81,430. --- MAX SCENARIO (INR 15,69,030): 2× MCCQE1 (170190) + 2× NAC OSCE (345260) + 2× MCCQE2 (325130) + OET (37500) + CPSO (32025) + CaRMS 20 programs (CAD$325+20×$35=CAD$1025=62525) + Credential verification (42395) + Work permit (15555) + PR Express Entry CAD$1450 (88450) + Full coaching (150000) + Travel 2 trips (180000) + Premium accommodation 2 trips (100000) + PCC (5000) + Medical (15000) = INR 15,69,030. --- KEY NOTES: (1) MCC exam pathway is sequential: MCCQE1 (computer-based MCQ) → NAC OSCE (clinical stations) → CaRMS match into residency → MCCQE2 (clinical exam during/after residency) → LMCC (Licentiate of the Medical Council of Canada). (2) NAC OSCE is held at designated centres across Canada — travel to Canada is mandatory for this exam. (3) MCCQE Part 1 can be taken at Prometric centres worldwide including India. (4) CaRMS fee depends on number of programs ranked: base CAD$325 + CAD$35 per program; typical IMG applies to 12-20 programs. (5) Provincial medical license fee varies by province: CPSO Ontario=CAD$525; CPSBC British Columbia=CAD$575; CPSA Alberta=CAD$450 — Ontario (CPSO) used as reference. (6) physiciansapply.ca manages source verification of medical credentials for MCC; WES (World Education Services) may also be required for immigration credential assessment. (7) Work permit fee: CAD$255 standard; study permit CAD$150; open work permit CAD$100; biometrics CAD$85 additional. (8) PR via Express Entry: processing fee CAD$850 + right of permanent residence fee (RPRF) CAD$515 + biometrics CAD$85 = CAD$1450 total. (9) NAC OSCE pass rate for IMGs historically ~60-65% — coaching is strongly recommended. (10) Residency in Canada is PAID — residents earn CAD$55k-75k/yr during training; however securing a CaRMS match is highly competitive for IMGs with ~30-35% match rate in first iteration. (11) MCCQE Part 1 fee increased from CAD$1280 to CAD$1395 effective 2025. (12) AUD/INR rate 63.42 used only for OET fee conversion.
